cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.CC 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category as it deals with decoding of polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting code used in information theory. The paper also discusses computational complexity, which is a common topic in this sub-category. 

The paper may also belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category as it deals with designing a scheme for decoding polar codes, which can be seen as a control problem. 

The Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper discusses a specific algorithm for decoding polar codes. 

The Network and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category is a possibility as polar codes are used in communication systems, which are a key component of network and internet architecture. 

Finally, the Computer Communications (cs.CC) sub-category is a possibility as the paper discusses a scheme for improving error correction performance in communication systems.
